intro: Chaerophyllum temulum, commonly known as the slender cow-wheat, is a herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, greenish-white flowers that bloom in early spring. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as woodlands and stream banks. Its botanical structure supports its role as a food source for various insects and contributes to the biodiversity of its ecosystem.
